intro: Carex schreberi var. gracillima, commonly known as slender sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flowers in spikelets. This variety is native to parts of Europe and is often found in wet or moist habitats such as marshes and stream banks. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has a rhizomatous root system. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
